page.title: Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women

rev.diff:
Line 52: Line 52:
{{Main|List of parties to the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women}}
{{Main|List of parties to the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women}}
â
The six UN member states that have not ratified or acceded to the convention are [[Iran]], [[Palau]], [[Somalia]], [[Sudan]], [[Tonga]], and the [[United States]]. These include Islamic states (Iran, Somalia, Sudan) and small Pacific Island nations (Palau, Tonga) and the United States has signed it, but not yet ratified it <ref name="Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women"> [http://treaties.un.org/Pages/ViewDetails.aspx?src=TREATY&mtdsg_no=IV-8&chapter=4&lang=en 'Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women']</ref>
+
The six UN member states that have not ratified or acceded to the convention are [[Iran]], [[Palau]], [[Somalia]], [[Sudan]], [[Tonga]], and the [[United States]]. These include Islamic states (Iran, Somalia, Sudan) or small Pacific Island nations (Palau, Tonga). [[Niue]] and the [[Vatican City]] have also not signed it, while the [[United States]] has signed it, but not yet ratified it.<ref>[http://www.un.org/womenwatch/daw/cedaw/protocol/CEDAW%20Ratification%20Table%20IV-8.en.pdf Member states]</ref>
â
Two Non-member UN states have not signed the convention they are the [[United Nations General Assembly observers#Non-member states|non-member permanent observer state]] the [[Vatican City]] and the [[Associated state]] [[Niue]].<ref name="Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women" />
+
In 2007, The Republic of China (Taiwan) has also ratified the treaty in its legislature, but is unrecognized by the United Nations and is a party to the treaty only unofficially.<ref>Government Information Office, Republic of China (Taiwan). "Taiwan Aims to Sign Up Against Discrimination." September 8, 2006.</ref>
â
The Republic of China (Taiwan) in 2007 has also ratified the treaty in its legislature, but is unrecognized by the United Nations and is a party to the treaty only unofficially.<ref>Government Information Office, Republic of China (Taiwan). "Taiwan Aims to Sign Up Against Discrimination." September 8, 2006.</ref>
+
The lastest state to sign and ratify the convention was [[Nauru]] on the June 23, 2011. <ref>http://treaties.un.org/Pages/ViewDetails.aspx?src=TREATY&mtdsg_no=IV-8&chapter=4&lang=en</ref>
â   â
The lastest state to sign and ratify the convention was [[Nauru]] on the June 23, 2011.<ref name="Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women" />
 
==Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women==
